title: Account Updater Service
description: Designed unified Account Updater service integrating Visa VAU, Mastercard ABU/RTAU, Discover GAU, and Amex Cardrefresher, reducing recurring payment declines by ~33%.
fullDescription: An automated account updater platform that synchronizes card-on-file data with issuer records across all major card networks. The system handles batch and real-time updates, ensuring merchants always have current card credentials for recurring billing.
problem: Merchants handling recurring transactions were experiencing high decline rates due to expired, replaced, or updated card credentials that weren't being communicated to their systems.
constraints: Required integration with proprietary protocols from each card network (Visa VAU, Mastercard ABU/RTAU, Discover GAU, Amex Cardrefresher). Must maintain PCI-DSS compliance throughout the update lifecycle.
approach: Built a unified abstraction layer over the four network-specific protocols. Implemented batch processing with intelligent retry logic and real-time update webhooks for merchants.
tradeoffs: Chose batch-first approach for reliability, adding real-time (RTAU) as an enhancement. Accepted higher storage costs to maintain update history for dispute support.
execution: Phased implementation starting with Visa VAU, then adding Mastercard ABU/RTAU, Discover GAU, and Amex Cardrefresher. Weekly deployments with comprehensive testing gates.
outcomes: Reduced recurring payment declines by approximately 33%. Enabled seamless payment processing for high-volume merchants supporting millions of monthly transactions globally.
whatIdImprove: Would add more proactive alerting for issuer-side delays and build merchant self-service dashboards earlier.
